item.title: Myanmar: Crimes against humanity committed systematically, says UN report
item.description: Crimes against humanity continue to be systematically committed in Myanmar, with ongoing conflicts severely impacting women and children, according to a UN report released on Tuesday.

item.title: From the Field: Keeping China’s minority traditions alive
item.description: In China, ethnic minority women from the 55 ethnic minority groups formally recognized by the country, are playing a vital role in protecting traditional knowledge and preserving cultural heritage.

item.title: UN Committee reviews anti-discrimination efforts underway
item.description: The Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination opened in Geneva on Monday to review anti-discrimination efforts being done in seven UN Member States.

item.title: Step up protection for activists who challenge big business in Colombia
item.description: Activists who raise concerns about business projects in Colombia are under serious threat for speaking out, and UN human rights experts are urging the government to do much more to protect them.

item.title: New sculpture at UN honours rights experts killed in DR Congo
item.description: A powerful new sculpture unveiled at UN Headquarters on Wednesday honours the memory and mission of two human rights experts who were murdered in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) five years ago.

item.title: Human rights experts call for international investigation into 2020 Beirut explosion
item.description: A cohort of independent UN experts has called on the Human Rights Council to launch an international investigation into the massive explosion in Beirut two year ago, with a view to securing justice for those who died and were injured.

item.title: Press freedom increasingly under threat in Cambodia – UN human rights report
item.description: Amid growing restrictions on civic space and press freedoms in Cambodia, journalists are being increasingly subjected to various forms of harassment, pressure, and violence, according to a new report published on Wednesday by the UN Human Rights Office (OHCHR).

item.title: UN Human Rights Office 'deplores' executions in Singapore
item.description: The UN Human Rights Office (OHCHR) denounced on Tuesday the hanging of two inmates in Changi Prison, located in the eastern part of Singapore.

item.title: UN delegation returns from human rights fact-finding mission in Ethiopia
item.description: Three UN-appointed independent human rights experts returned from Ethiopia on Tuesday after working to negotiate access to areas important for investigations.

item.title: Nicaragua: Rights experts denounce shutdown of over 700 civil society groups
item.description: The arbitrary shutdown of hundreds of civil society organizations in Nicaragua is deeply concerning and will have a chilling effect on activists and human rights defenders across the country, UN-appointed independent human rights experts said on Friday.

item.title: UN Committee against Torture: Focus on Botswana, Nicaragua, Palestine, United Arab Emirates
item.description: The UN Committee against Torture on Friday concluded its current session by releasing findings on Botswana, Nicaragua, the State of Palestine and the United Arab Emirates

item.title: Human trafficking: ‘All-out assault’ on rights, safety and dignity, says UN chief
item.description: Human trafficking is a horrific crime and “an all-out assault on people’s rights, safety and dignity,” Secretary-General António Guterres said on Friday, the eve of World Day Against Trafficking in Persons.

item.title: Singapore: Rights experts call for moratorium on executions for drugs offences
item.description: Singapore must implement an immediate moratorium on executions for drug offences, UN human rights experts said on Friday, in a statement condemning the recent hanging of a 64-year-old man for drug trafficking – the fifth person to be executed there this year.

item.title: Top rights expert questions ‘double standard’ on Ukraine’s war displaced
item.description: A top UN-appointed human rights expert on Thursday raised the issue of an alleged “double standard” in Poland and Belarus towards those forced to flee the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Top rights experts urge repeal of Hong Kong’s national security law
item.description: Independent UN-appointed human rights experts who have urged China to repeal Hong Kong’s 2020 national security law (NSL) after claiming that its use had led to the arrest of children, said on Wednesday that they welcomed pledges to replace it with a more transparent and consultative process.

item.title: Türkiye urged to reverse decision ditching women’s rights accord
item.description: Türkiye’s decision to ditch a landmark international treaty to tackle violence against women and girls, could significantly set back efforts to tackle the problem, top UN-appointed independent rights expert said on Wednesday.

item.title: Colombia: New government urged to combat rising violence in rural areas
item.description: The incoming administration in Colombia must prioritize tackling rising violence perpetrated by non-State armed groups and criminal organizations in rural areas, the UN human rights office, OHCHR, said in a report published on Tuesday.

item.title: Syria: Australian teen’s death in prison was ‘utterly preventable’, rights experts say
item.description: Australian authorities must speed up the repatriation of their nationals held in detention centres in Syria following the recent confirmation of the death of a Sydney teenager at a facility in the northeast, UN human rights experts said on Monday.

item.title: Myanmar junta's execution of four democracy activists condemned by UN
item.description: The independent UN human rights expert for Myanmar called for a strong international response on Monday following the executions of four pro-democracy activists by the country’s military junta. In a statement issued later in the day, UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet said she was "dismayed" that despite appeal from across the world, military leaders had move ahead with "no regard" for international rights law.

item.title: Why the UN General Assembly must back the right to a healthy environment
item.description: In late July, the UN General Assembly is expected to vote on a draft resolution recognizing the human right to a clean, healthy and sustainable environment.

item.title: UN condemns election-related violence across Papua New Guinea Highlands
item.description: The UN on Thursday “unequivocally” condemned the recent escalation of violence across the Highlands region of Papua New Guinea (PNG) which has erupted during the ongoing two week period of staggered voting for national elections.

item.title: Respect for fundamental rights key to peaceful elections in Kenya: UN experts
item.description: Independent UN human rights experts on Thursday called on authorities and political candidates standing in next month’s general election to foster an enabling civic space to ensure the vote goes ahead peacefully, and prevent violence.

item.title: UN rights chief calls for ‘political responsibility’ to address Peru’s challenges
item.description: The role of electoral authorities is fundamental to protect democratic space in Peru, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Michelle Bachelet said in the capital, Lima, on Wednesday, concluding a two-day mission to the country.

item.title: Sri Lanka economic crisis requires ‘immediate global attention’: Rights experts
item.description: Greater support must be given to Sri Lanka as the country faces economic crisis and political turmoil, a group of UN human rights experts said on Wednesday in an appeal to the international community.

item.title: Afghanistan: Report highlights multiple human rights violations and abuses under Taliban
item.description: A new report from the UN Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) released on Wednesday, confirms the erosion of basic human rights across the country since the Taliban takeover in August last year, pointing out they bear responsibility for extrajudicial killings, torture, arbitrary arrests and detentions, and violations of fundamental freedoms.

item.title: ‘I will never stop telling my story’: Confronting victim-blaming for sexual assault
item.description: Imagine enduring a terrifying sexual attack. Bruised and shaken, you recount what happened to the police only for them to turn the tables on you, by asking: what were you wearing?

item.title: Best way to protect children caught in conflict is to ‘champion peace’: Gamba
item.description: The best way to protect children and prevent violations against them during armed conflict is to “promote and champion peace,” the UN Special Representative for Children and Armed Conflict told the Security Council on Tuesday.

item.title: UN publishes new guidance on curbing child abduction and other ‘grave violations’ in war
item.description: The UN’s top official advocating for children caught up in armed conflict issued new guidance on Monday designed to help expert staff on the ground protect children who are abducted, or who suffer other grave violations.

item.title: Kenya: UN expert hails historic reparations ruling in favour of indigenous peoples
item.description: An independent UN human rights expert on Monday hailed a decision by the African Court on Human and People’s Rights, to award reparations to the Ogiek indigenous peoples, for harm that they suffered due to “injustices and discrimination.”

item.title: Guterres hails healer and ‘mentor to generations’, Nelson Mandela
item.description: The UN chief in his message to mark Monday's International Day in honour of Nelson Mandela, hailed the first Black President of post-Apartheid South Africa and racial justice icon, “a giant of our time”, who remains a “moral compass” for us all.
